1.text: And I say, for as long time as the heir is a child, he differs nothing from a servant, being lord of all;

2.text: But is under guardians and stewards until the time appointed by the father.

3.text: So also we, when we were children, were subjugated under the worldâ€™s elements:

4.text: And when the completion of the time was come, God sent his Son, born of woman, born under the law,

5.text: That he might redeem them under the law, that we might receive the adoption as sons.

6.text: And because ye are sons, God sent forth the Spirit of his Son into your hearts, crying, Abba, Father.

7.text: So that thou art no more a servant, but a son: and if a son, also an heir of God through Christ.

8.text: But then truly, not having known God, ye were in a servile condition to them not being gods by nature.

9.text: And now, having known God, and rather known of God, how turn ye again to the weak and poor elements, to which again ye wish anew to be in a servile condition.

10.text: Ye observe narrowly days, and months, and times, and years.

11.text: I am afraid of you, lest I have been wearied for you in vain.

12.text: Be ye as I, for I also as you, brethren, I pray you: ye injured me nothing.

13.text: And ye know that through weakness of the flesh I announced the good news to you before.

14.text: And my temptation in my flesh, ye counted not as nothing, nor spurned; but as an angel of God ye received me, as Christ Jesus.

15.text: What then was your happiness? for I testify to you, that, if possible, having plucked out your eyes, ye would have given to me.

16.text: Have I then been your enemy, speaking truth to you.

17.text: They are zealous for you, not well; but they wish to exclude you, that ye might be zealous for them.

18.text: And good to be zealous always in good, and not only in my being present with you.

19.text: My children, for whom I am again in travail until Christ be formed in you,

20.text: And I would be present with you now, and change my voice; for I am perplexed about you.

21.text: Tell me, those wishing to be under the law, do ye not hear the law?

22.text: For it has been written, that Abraham had two sons, one by the bondmaid, and one by the free.

23.text: But he truly of the bondmaid was born according to the flesh; and he of the free through the promise.

24.text: Which things are spoken figuratively: for these are the two covenants; one truly from mount Sinai, begetting to bondage, which is Agar.

25.text: For Agar is mount Sinai in Arabia, and now stands in the same rank With Jerusalem, and is in a servile condition with her children.

26.text: But Jerusalem above is free, which is mother of us all.

27.text: For it has been written, Be cheered, O barren, bearing not; break out and cry, she travailing not: for many more the children of the desolate than she having a husband.

28.text: And we, brethren, as Isaac, are children of promise.

29.text: But as then he born according to the flesh drove out him according to the Spirit, so also now.

30.text: But what says the writing? Cast out the bondmaid and her son; for the son of the bondmaid shall not inherit with the son of the free.

31.text: Therefore, brethren, we are not children of the bondmaid, but of the free.
